intro: Pritzelia princeps, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. Pritzelia princeps is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
